trans-unit.source: Provides static methods that facilitate transferring data to and from the system Clipboard.
All applications for [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] share the system Clipboard, so the contents are subject to change when you switch to another application.
For a list of predefined formats available to use with the Clipboard class, see the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> class.
**Security Alert:** For security purposes, the following points should be kept in mind.
- Paste operations need to be user initiated (Ctrl-V, Paste Menu).
- Copy can only be on user selected content.
- On copy or cut, partial trust code puts plaintext and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] on to the clipboard.
Plaintext includes text, Unicode text, OEM (Object Exchange Model) text, and CSV (Comma-separated values).

- On paste, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] will paste in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] if the source of that content is from a equally trusted or more trusted site.
Specifically: - A partial trust application can paste [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] from a full trust application.
- A partial trust application can paste [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] from a partial trust application.
- A full trust application can paste XAML only from another fully trusted application.
- A non-[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] full trust application can examine the ApplicationTrust format on the clipboard and sanitize the XAML if appropriate.
Clears any data from the system Clipboard.
Calling this method is equivalent to calling **OleSetClipboard**(**null**).
Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively on the Clipboard; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Clipboard contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in a specified data format.

A query for the data format <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap> or <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop> will return `true` if the data can be automatically converted to the specified data format.
For other data formats, this method returns `true` only if the specified format is available natively on the Clipboard.
The format of the data to look for.
See <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> for predefined formats.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if data in the specified format is available on the Clipboard; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
See Remarks.
format is .
Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop"></xref> data format.

This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively or is available as an auto-convertible data format on the Clipboard; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Clipboard contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> data format.

This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively or is available as an auto-convertible data format on the Clipboard; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Clipboard contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively on the Clipboard; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
The <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText> data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and USC-2.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Clipboard contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in a text data format.
This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively in the data object; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
A member of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref> enumeration that specifies the text data format to query for.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Clipboard contains data in the specified text data format; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
format does not specify a valid member of .
Permanently adds the data that is on the <xref href="System.Windows.Clipboard"></xref> so that it is available after the data's original application closes.
Returns a stream of Clipboard data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format.
This method returns a stream only if the specified format exists natively in the data object; this method does not return auto-convertible data.

A stream that contains the data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the Clipboard does not contain data in this format.
Retrieves data in a specified format from the Clipboard.
A string that specifies the format of the data to retrieve.
For a set of predefined data formats, see the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class.
An object that contains the data in the specified format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in the specified format.
format is .
Returns a data object that represents the entire contents of the Clipboard.
Access to data on the system Clipboard is enabled through a *data object*, that is, an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface.
A list of predefined formats is defined by the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> class.
Use the methods specified by <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> and fields in <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> to examine and extract the data from the data object.
To examine the formats of data on the system Clipboard, call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetFormats%2A> on the data object returned by this method.
To retrieve data from the system Clipboard, call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> and specify the desired data format.
The system Clipboard is shared by all applications, so data on the Clipboard is subject to change by other applications.
A data object that enables access to the entire contents of the system Clipboard, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there is no data on the Clipboard.
Returns a string collection that contains a list of dropped files available on the Clipboard.

A collection of strings, where each string specifies the name of a file in the list of dropped files on the Clipboard, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in this format.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object from the Clipboard that contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> format.

This method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> object, either when data is available natively or when data can be auto-converted to the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap> data format.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object that contains data in the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> format, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data is unavailable in this format.
Returns a string containing the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data on the Clipboard.
The <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText> data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and UCS-2.

A string containing the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data , or an empty string if no <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data is available on the Clipboard.
Returns a string containing text data on the Clipboard.
A member of <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref> that specifies the text data format to retrieve.
A string containing text data in the specified data format, or an empty string if no corresponding text data is available.
Compares a specified data object to the contents of the Clipboard.
Use this method to determine if a data object that was previously placed on the Clipboard is still present and unmodified.
A data object to compare to the contents of the system Clipboard.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified data object matches what is on the system Clipboard; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
data is .
An error occurred when accessing the Clipboard.

The exception details will include an <xref uid="langword_csharp_HResult" name="HResult" href=""></xref> that identifies the specific error; see <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ErrorWrapper.ErrorCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Stores audio data (<xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format) on the Clipboard.
The audio data is specified as a byte array.
This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled.
A byte array that contains audio data to store on the Clipboard.
audioBytes is .
Stores audio data (<xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio"></xref> data format) on the Clipboard.
The audio data is specified as a stream.
This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled.
A stream that contains audio data to store on the Clipboard.
audioStream is .
Stores the specified data on the Clipboard in the specified format.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled if the corresponding data format is <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop> or <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap>.
Otherwise, auto-conversion is disabled.
A string that specifies the format to use to store the data.
See the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats"></xref> class for a set of predefined data formats.
An object representing the data to store on the Clipboard.
Places a specified non-persistent data object on the system Clipboard.
By default, data placed on the system Clipboard with <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.SetDataObject%2A> is automatically cleared from the Clipboard when the application exits.

> [!NOTE] > The default behavior of clearing the Clipboard on application exit might differ from other implementations, which might leave data on the Clipboard on application exit rather than clearing it by default.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.SetDataObject%2A> overload and specify the `copy` parameter as `true` if you do not want data cleared from the Clipboard on application exit.
> > <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> provides a basic implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface.
A data object (an object that implements <xref href="System.Windows.IDataObject"></xref>) to place on the system Clipboard.
data is .
An error occurred when accessing the Clipboard.

The exception details will include an <xref uid="langword_csharp_HResult" name="HResult" href=""></xref> that identifies the specific error; see <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ErrorWrapper.ErrorCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Places a specified data object on the system Clipboard and accepts a Boolean parameter that indicates whether the data object should be left on the Clipboard when the application exits.
<xref:System.Windows.DataObject> provides a basic implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface.
<xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.IsCurrent%2A> determines the data object previously placed on the clipboard by the last <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.SetDataObject%2A> call.
A data object (an object that implements <xref href="System.Windows.IDataObject"></xref>) to place on the system Clipboard.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to leave the data on the system Clipboard when the application exits; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to clear the data from the system Clipboard when the application exits.
data is .
An error occured when accessing the Clipboard.

The exception details will include an <xref uid="langword_csharp_HResult" name="HResult" href=""></xref> that identifies the specific error; see <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ErrorWrapper.ErrorCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Stores <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop"></xref> data on the Clipboard.
The dropped file list is specified as a string collection.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled.
A string collection that contains the dropped file list to store in the data object.
fileDropList is .
fileDropList contains zero strings, or the full path to file specified in the list cannot be resolved.
Stores <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap"></xref> data on the Clipboard.
The image data is specified as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.
This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> object that contains the image data to store on the Clipboard.
Stores <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data on the Clipboard.
This data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and UCS-2.
This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled.
A string that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data to store on the Clipboard.
text is .
Stores text data on the Clipboard in a specified text data format.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText"></xref> data to store is specified as a string.
This method adds data with auto-conversion disabled.
A string that contains the text data to store on the Clipboard.
A member of <xref href="System.Windows.TextDataFormat"></xref> that specifies the specific text data format to store.
text is .
